und.value:
An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.3 occurred about 55 miles north of Guam in the Pacific Ocean, Wed., April 23, 1997, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

The earthquake occurred at 3:44 p.m. EDT or 5:44 a.m., Thurs., April 24, local time on Guam.

The USGS received early reports that the earthquake was felt on Saipan, north of Guam.
